stepAnswer: $$r$$ is the radius of the directed line segment from the pole, the angle theta indicates the direction of $$r$$ in radians
stepTitle: What does the (r,theta) pairs of polar coordinates represent?
answerLatex: $$r$$ is the radius of the directed line segment from the pole, the angle theta indicates the direction of $$r$$ in radians
choices: $$r$$ is the radius of the directed line segment from the pole, the angle theta indicates the direction of $$r$$ in radians
$$r$$ is the scale of the $$x$$ axis, the angle theta indicates the direction of $$x$$ in radians
$$r$$ indicates the direction of $$r$$ in radians, the angle theta is the radius of the directed line segment from the pole
